Spaceflight alone does not affect the Ab repertoire, study shows . Microgravity, antiorthostatic suspension (AOS) affects the Ab . repertoire after vaccination in both the spleen and bone marrow .

Spleen and BM experiments were sequenced for the spleen and the BM experiments based on the highest values for their respective experiments . Animals in three pools were pooled in a new study . Each animal contained spleen from two unique animals .

Eight treatment groups were established, each containing 10 animals . Half of the animals were loading and half unloaded . Half were control animals that were fully weight bearing on their hind limbs . All animals were singly housed because of AOS requirements .
Kansas State University Integrated Genomics Facility performed sequencing as previously described . For all datasets, KSU performed sequencing on the same datasets as previously reported .

Total RNA was size selected (275–800 nt) and sequenced on the Illumina MiSeq at 2 × 300 . Sequences were mapped to C57BL/6 V-gene segments and the IgH loci . Rank-abundance curves were generated for CDR3s comprising an abundance of over 0.01 in the repertoire .  The CDR3 distribution was determined by the rank abundance of normal C57BL6/Tac mice that were flown in space for a period of 21–22 d . Three individual CASIS animals were subjected to spaceflight and compared with normal controls .
The overall comparisons comprise all animals in the CASIS and TARDIS experiments . We generated rank-abundance curves for CDR3s from the TARDIS mice from the treatment groups .
Spleen and bone marrow were sequenced in 18 animals in the TARDIS study . The study allowed direct comparisons of population diversity between the spleen and the bone marrow .

We probed our data to identify principal components driving the impact on CDR3 present in the TARDIS mouse spleen . We also assessed all experiments used in this article . However, no clustering or significant principal components emerged from the PCA analyses .
Study examines total of 1,173,166 unique Ab sequences arising from 44 individual and 18 pooled animals across four experiments .

The study suggests that there is more sharing of repertoires than previously estimated . Age is known to affect the Ab repertoire by reducing diversity . The animals used in this experiment were older (35 wk at flight), and a different strain (C57BL/6Tac) than used in the other experiments .

The CASIS animals had significantly lower SIs compared with the complete TARDIS dataset . CASIS mice were not statistically different from the TARDIS animals . In the bone marrow, only TT-treated animals showed a reduced diversity SIs .
One pool of mice showed an extreme response with the result that almost 17% of the repertoire is composed of one CDR3, CASYSNFDYW . The high repertoire percentage likely arose in a single animal .
